title: Robust Simulations
text:
This page contains supplementary materials for Chapter 6 of the thesis Robust Statistical Methods and the Credibility Movement of Psychological Science. The code for reproducing the plots found on this page can be accessed at osf.io/jvdrp.






Important



Some of the summaries are extremely large files so they can take a few seconds to load properly. The designs with combined predictors (with interactions) summarise hundreds of conditions and occasionally the browser struggles to open them. Iâ€™m working on a more long-term fix for this, but if the page crashes, usually returning to the main page and trying load the relevant summary again gets around the problem.


The summaries are split into four main sections:

Between-subjects designs with categorical predictors
Cross-sectional designs with numeric-only predictors
Cross-sectional designs with combined numeric and categorical predictors
Within subjects and mixed designs

Each section contains summaries for individual designs, including the overall model fit, rates of false positives, statistical power, accuracy of estimates, estimation efficiency, coverage of confidence intervals, and rates of model convergence errors.
Each plot shows sample size on the X axis and relevant metric on the Y axis. Columns are defined by the effect size and rows are grouped by a combinations of remaining parameters.
To save space on the plots, some labels use shorter codes - these are specified in the table below.



Code
Description




het_shape
Heteroscedastic shape/variance pattern


N cat. preds
Number of categorical predictors


N cont. preds
Number of numeric/continuous predictors


n_het
Number of heteroscedastic predictors


N preds
Number of predictors


N ratio
Sample size ratio


target_het
Target heteroscedasticity value on the QLI measure


vp1
Homoscedastic variance pattern


vp2
Butterfly variance pattern


vp3
Inverse butterfly variance pattern


vp4
Funnel variance pattern


VR
Variance ratio
